## Type of Change

<!-- Mark the relevant option with an [x] -->

- [ ] Fix: Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] Add: New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Update: Changes to existing functionality
- [ ] Refactor: Code refactoring without functional changes
- [ ] Docs: Documentation updates
- [ ] Test: Adding or updating tests
- [ ] Breaking change: Changes that break existing functionality

## Code Quality Checklist

- [ ] Code follows the project's coding standards
  - [ ] PascalCase for classes
  - [ ] camelCase for functions
  - [ ] snake_case for variables
  - [ ] UPPER_SNAKE_CASE for constants
  - [ ] snake_case_ for private member variables
- [ ] License header included in new files
- [ ] Code formatted with clang-format
- [ ] No compiler warnings introduced
- [ ] Code passes static analysis (cppcheck, clang-tidy)
- [ ] British English used in comments and documentation

## Commit Message Checklist

- [ ] Commit messages follow conventions (Add:/Fix:/Update:/Refactor:/Docs:/Test:)
- [ ] Commits are atomic and focused
- [ ] Commit messages are clear and descriptive
